intro: Artanthe cumanensis, commonly known as the Cumanensis artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Artanthe cumanensis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
